key_points: The Biden inauguration ceremony faced limitations due to the coronavirus pandemic and recent security threats.
Crowd sizes were limited with mask wearing and social distancing enforced to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
Former President Donald Trump did not attend the inauguration, marking a notable absence.
Washington D.C. experienced heightened security following a pro-Trump riot earlier in the month.
Misinformation surrounding the 2020 election and Inauguration Day has been prevalent.
False claims circulated that flags were added to the National Mall to make the inauguration look less empty.
The flags were part of a public art exhibition representing Americans unable to attend due to COVID-19.
Biden's inauguration maintained strict coronavirus precautions, continuing practices from his presidential campaign.
The absence of large crowds marks a significant change from traditional inauguration ceremonies.
The claim that flags were used to fill space was rated as missing context due to the pandemic and security measures.
